TI: [Heterochronic effects of neurotrophic factors in neurochemical organization of learning and memory in the adult organism].
AB: Following elaboration of long-term habituation to a startle-response, antibodies to neurotrophic factor protein S100b exerted selective and dose-dependent influence on different learning processes and memory of learned behavioural patterns in adult rats. S100b increased at all stages of behavioural skill development in hippocampus, hypothalamus, frontal cortex, cerebellar hemispheres and vermis, basal ganglia.
AD: P. K. Anokhin Research Institute of Normal Physiology, Russian Acad. Med. Sci., 103009, Moscow, B. Nikitskaya, 6, Russia.
TT: Geterokhronia uchastiia neirotroficheskikh faktorov v neirokhimicheskoi organizatsii protsessov obucheniia i pamiati v zrelom organizme.
TA: Ross Fiziol Zh Im I M Sechenova
JT: Rossiiskii fiziologicheskii zhurnal imeni I.M. Sechenova
MH: S100 Calcium Binding Protein beta Subunit
SO: Ross Fiziol Zh Im I M Sechenova. 2001 Jun;87(6):752-61.
